If you are a lover of hidden stories and mystery, this is your route. But, come prepared, what we will tell you will freeze your blood.

name: Discover the Prado Museum Free Tour (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Has it ever happened to you that you visit a museum and you don't even know where to start from the amount of works there are? If you want to know the Prado Museum and prevent this from happening to you again, this is your Free Tour !!.

We will visit the rooms of this fascinating place and I will explain its most important works in a different way. We will focus on the symbolism of the paintings, the secrets they hide, as well as the curiosities that make them so special; traveling to places like Germany, Italy and the Netherlands.

During our visit we will see some of the best known pictorial genres (portraits, religious paintings, mythological paintings ...) through such emblematic works as Las Meninas by Velázquez , Las Tres Graces by Rubens , El Jardín de las Delicias by El Bosco or Las Majas de Goya . You can not lose this!!!


In addition, I will tell you curiosities about the Prado Museum itself: Why is it called that? How was its collection formed? What happened to the works during the Spanish Civil War? ...
and much more!.

I'll wait for you in front of the Museum's ticket office, at the Goya statue, the only one that looks at the museum, unlike the one by Murillo and Velázquez. You want to know why? Sign up for the Free Tour and I'll tell you about it!

shortDescription:
The artistic heritage that was lost during the Civil War . Discover everything that was destroyed in Madrid .

Itinerary:
We will start the tour at the Prado Museum , home to the most important painting collection in the world. What happened to the works that were exhibited inside? Did it get into good hands? Was it re-exposed as it was known?

We will continue the tour until we reach the Palacio del Marqués de Torrecilla , current Ministry of Finance and Public Function. Located on Calle Alcalá, near the ground floor where the headquarters of the defense council was located, can you imagine how the building could finish?

During the walk we will leave behind such characteristic monuments of Madrid such as the Neptune Fountain , which together with the Cibeles Fountain and the Puerta de Alcalá , were covered to protect them from air attacks. Did they manage to survive the attack?

Next, we will arrive at the Cuartel de la Montaña , current Temple of Debod , where a battle was waged that killed 200 people in just a few hours. From this mountain we will enjoy the views that Madrid offers us and we will immerse ourselves a little more in the battles that were fought to conquer the capital.

We will finish the visit at the Palacio de Liria , one of the private palaces that houses one of the most important art collections in the world.

  • Congress of Deputies
  • Puerta del Sol with its respective monuments and its famous Tío Pepe poster
  • Royal Theatre

Segovia and Spanish Versailles Full-Day Tour with Wine Tasting
description:
An hour north of Madrid and altitude of 1000 meters lies the picturesque and magical town of Segovia. The famous Alcazar Castle located on a cliff overlooking rivers and green fields has become the inspiration in Walt Disney's films.

We will begin our journey during Spain's glorious days in the “La Granja” Gardens complex, which is also called the "Spanish Versailles Gardens" including dozens of ornamental pools, fountains and greenery brought to the palace from all over the world.

The second part of the tour will take place in the Ancient City of Segovia where we will find one of the world's largest aqueducts. From there we will continue to the main market square, the last Gothic Cathedral built in Spain and the old Jewish quarter.

During the tour we will stop for a wine tasting and get to eat the local dessert that is particularly famous for being one of Spain's Queens favorite. From there we will continue to the highlight of the city, the Royal Palace- the Alcazar

description:
Dozens of bakeries and Patisseries are located in the Old City of Madrid, which hide their stories behind the counter and baking ovens. If you are a sweet lover and looking for a special way to get to know the city, we invite you to join us in Madrid's most mythological businesses that specialize in the production of marzipan, mini-pastry, breads and other fine desserts, each with its own story and history.

As part of the tour, we will discover which cake received the “Order of Knights badge”, which bakery was built by the Queen's order, what is the origin of the famous churros that had conquered the world and what secret candies were given to the King's secret lover.

Each story will spark your imagination and leave you with a sweet taste in your mouth.
In every business we visit we will hear about the design, serving style and unique recipes of the pastry chef and the owner that will make you embrace the Spanish saying in sweet "The taste overcomes the aesthetic".

name: Skip-the-Line Prado Museum Madrid Guided Tour - Private Tour
description: Spain’s response to the Louvre, the Prado Museum is a marvel of art and history. On this 2.5 hour private guided museum tour, you will explore this world-class collection featuring some of Europe’s most famous artists. One of the most visited sites in the world, the Prado is essential for any trip to Madrid, and your enthusiastic guide will bring the most famous works alive during your tour.

name: Prado and Reina Sofia Skip-the-Line Guided Art Tour
description:
Join our art tour and visit two of the world's most important museums, featuring the finest works of art by the world's most renowned artists: Velasquez, Goya, Rubens, Raphael, Salvador Dali, Titian, Joan Miro and Pablo Picasso.
The tour will begin at the Prado Museum, which is known as the world's finest classical art museum, with thousands of works of art in changing exhibitions.

Among the variety of exhibition halls, we will glimpse in the painting’s collections of the kings of Spain, which reflect their artistic taste throughout history and the political circumstances that led to their acquisition.

The second part of the tour will take place at the Museum of Modern Art, Reina Sofia, where we will see works from early modernism, contemporary art, painting, sculpture and of course the diamond in the crown - Picasso's "Guernica" which describes the destruction and horrors that Spain suffered during the Civil War.

Walking through the streets and squares of old Madrid , we will relive the stories and legends that bring us closer to the love affairs of Barbara de Blomberg, Bishop Carrillo, the Borgia Pope or the Princess of Éboli , and we will learn about Felipe II's taste for paintings Titian's erotic works, Juana I 's jealous attacks towards her own ladies, the endless parties between women, wine, music and games that made Felipe III almost drown the royal coffers or the supposed beating that Felipe IV received when the Duke of Albuquerque discovered him with his wife.

Finally, we will see in Calle Mayor , the monument that pays tribute to the victims of the attack that took place at the wedding of Alfonso XIII and Victoria Eugenia . Then we will go to the Plaza de la Villa , where we will learn which famous French king was imprisoned in the Lujanes tower .

Thanks to this route we will discover that the things of love have changed very little in the last 500 years.
